intro: Neea amaruayensis, commonly known as the Amazonian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found near streams or in dense undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important component of the Amazonian ecosystem.
